zone.line: perfection that perfection which to which
human society is impelled by some active
power within each bosom, to aspire, how
great ought to our hopes, how resolute our
struggles. For the Greeks of the Periclean
Age were widely different from us, & it
were It is to be lamented that we have
no modern writer has hitherto dared to
precisely were Anac
shew them Greeks as they are. Barthelemy
cannot be denied the praise of industry
and system, but he never can forgets
Frenchman
that he is a christian & a European.
Wieland in his delightful novels makes
indeed a very tolerable Pagan, but
does cherishes too many political prejudices,
-ces, & refrains from diminishing
the interest of his romances by painting
sentiments in which no European
of modern times can possibly sympathize.
There is no book which shews the Greeks
